messages.subject: Re: Betterness
messages.msgSnippet: ... How on earth does saying I want to be better today than I was before sound like I am better than all of you ? We re all better and worse than all other
messages.messageBody:
----------
>From: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1506
>Date: Thu, Sep 27, 2001, 1:33 PM
>

>> HECK YES!
>> I want to be better today than I was before. I want to be better
>> next year than I am now.
>>
>> Sandra
>>
>
> Ah, Sandra, what you don't seem to know is that you sound like you are
> saying, "Yes I am better than all of YOU."


How on earth does saying "I want to be better today than I was before" sound
like "I am better than all of you"?

We're all better and worse than all other people in all possible areas of
knowledge and talent. A child molester may be better than me at violin
(couldn't be worse <g>) but much worse than me at child rearing. Michael
Jordan is billions of times better at basketball than my husband, but I'll
bet not as good as Wally at reading a story to our girls.

Striving for excellence in your own spheres of interest and talent is not
the same as declaring yourself the cat's ass.

Pam
